title: How much does it cost per copy to print a coffee-table book? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m assuming you are also looking at coated 70# paper and paper over board or hardcover with dust jacket? Domestically, my guess would be in the neighborhood of $1.75-2.25 per unit, including freight. We recently did some paper over board hardcovers that ended up costing about $2/unit at only 7,000 copies, though not quite as large as you are looking at. Still, I would think that you could find a comparable price with such a large run. At 25,000 units you would likely be maxing out domestic commercial pricing other than a few printers who specialize in 50,000+ units. For a run so large, stay away from Lightning Source of any digital printer. They will have the worst pricing for a job like this. If you’re serious, I would start with Taylor in Dallas. You’d be amazed at their domestic pricing and you are supporting real American labor instead of overworked children!

Through LightningSource.com it will cost you $6.00 per unit + $0.10 per page.  But they don't offer your exact size.  I just printed a book through them, perfect bound, full color and am really impressed with the print quality all my photos.
